@dhalperi 
for the question that whether to expose path.
as you said, that is the implementation details.

We can have HadoopResourceId that built on top of hadoop path, and UriResourceId that built on top of URI. And, we don't want to expose them as well.
also, added tests for GetScheme().

R: @amitsela
LGTM.

Hi @JingsongLi,
I love that you are putting so much work into the Flink runner but I think before changing this we need to tackle to other issues that I just created: 
 - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1393: Update Flink Runner to Flink 1.2.0
 - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1394: Use Flink InternalTimerService for TimerInternals

where the latter depends on the former. This will actually also simplify the implementation. Are you interested in working on those first?

For avoiding duplicate/redundant work it's good to mention that you are working on a Jira Issue and also to assign that issue to yourself. This way other people can now that you are working on something and won't do duplicate work.

Jira is also good for discussing implementation details.

Keep up the good work. üòÑ üëç And let me know if you want to know anything and/or want to work on these other Jira issues I just created.

R: @dhalperi / @kennknowles

Suggest some added testing:

- that this behavior is working as intended
- a regression test for the user issue (is there a new RunnableOnService test needed? is there something more targeted at Spark?)

Mmmm.. testing is a good question - even now, it might pass sometime, if by chance elements are ordered, so a test could be added (ROS) to check this and it should ALWAYS pass if no regression, but it might also pass if broken. Am I wrong here ?

You're right that it would be hard to guarantee a test would fail, but hopefully we can think of a test that would be flaky at least. It might be we get this "for free" as soon as we start running full integration tests with the ongoing performance work.

For the short term, I would expect to see a `SparkGroupAlsoByWindowFnTest` that unit tests the function here. (You can probably crib straight from the `GroupAlsoByWindowsViaOutputBufferDoFnTest` for much of the test setup/teardown/structure).
Thanks. @aaltay PTAL
